meanings.definition: A somersault in which a person lands on their hands and springs back to an upright position.
meanings.sent1: During the gymnastics competition, Sarah performed flawless handsprings.
meanings.sent2: The cheerleader amazed the crowd with her energetic handsprings.
meanings.sent3: The clown attempted to do handsprings but ended up in a tangled mess of limbs.
meanings.sent4: Her joy was like a handspring, flipping her mood from gloomy to cheerful in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The image of the acrobat's handsprings was etched in the audience's minds long after the show.

meanings.definition: A gymnastic move involving a series of consecutive handsprings.
meanings.sent1: The gymnast's routine included a breathtaking sequence of handsprings.
meanings.sent2: The coach taught the young athletes how to link handsprings together fluidly.
meanings.sent3: The penguin attempted to mimic the handsprings of the gymnast, resulting in a comical display.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a series of handsprings, propelling her towards her goal with agility.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of handsprings echoed through the gymnasium during practice sessions.
